Package org.opengrok.indexer.util

Class PathUtils

java.lang.Object
org.opengrok.indexer.util.PathUtils
public class PathUtils extends Object
Represents a container for file system paths-related utility methods.

    • getRelativeToCanonical

      public static String getRelativeToCanonical(Path path, Path canonical) throws IOException
      Calls getRelativeToCanonical(Path, Path, Set, Set) with path, canonical, allowedSymlinks=null, and canonicalRoots=null (to disable validation of links).
      Parameters:
      path - a non-canonical (or canonical) path to compare
      canonical - a canonical path to compare against
      Returns:
      a relative path determined as described -- or path if no canonical relativity is found.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs determining canonical paths for portions of path

    • getRelativeToCanonical

      public static String getRelativeToCanonical(Path path, Path canonical, Set<String> allowedSymlinks, Set<String> canonicalRoots) throws IOException, ForbiddenSymlinkException, InvalidPathException
      Determine a relative path comparing path to canonical, with an algorithm that can handle the possibility of one or more symbolic links as components of path.

      When allowedSymlinks is not null, any symbolic links as components of path (below canonical) are required to match an element of allowedSymlinks or target a canonical child of an element of allowedSymlinks.

      E.g., with path="/var/opengrok/src/proj_a" and canonical="/private/var/opengrok/src" where /var is linked to /private/var and where /var/opengrok/src/proj_a is linked to /proj/a, the function will return "proj_a" as a relative path.

      The algorithm will have evaluated canonical paths upward from (non-canonical) /var/opengrok/src/proj_a (a.k.a. /proj/a) to find a canonical similarity at /var/opengrok/src (a.k.a. /private/var/opengrok/src).

      Parameters:
      path - a non-canonical (or canonical) path to compare
      canonical - a canonical path to compare against
      allowedSymlinks - optional set of allowed symbolic links, so that any links encountered within path and not covered by the set (or whitelisted in a defined canonicalRoots) will abort the algorithm
      canonicalRoots - optional set of allowed canonicalRoots, so that any checks done because of a defined allowedSymlinks will first check against the whitelist of canonical roots and possibly short-circuit the explicit validation against allowedSymlinks.
      Returns:
      a relative path determined as described above -- or path if no canonical relativity is found
      Throws:
      ForbiddenSymlinkException - if symbolic-link checking is active and it encounters an ineligible link
      InvalidPathException - if path cannot be decoded
      IOException
